page.title: 07Nauls Mill Park: Coventry
page.content: Nauls Mills Park is the Coundon area of Coventry.It has also been called Hill Mill,Wragg's Mill,Abbott's Mill and Carters Mill.It is now named after the last owner who was called Naul.It was originally used for "fulling"(cleaning and thickening cloth).The Mill was built where Radford Brook crossed Abbotts Lane and was first recorded in the 11th Century.After the dissolution of the Monasteries the owners,Bartholemew and Thomas gave it to the Corporation in order to pay for a schoolmaster at Coventry Grammar School.In 1869 the Mill was owned by a silk "throwster"(a person who twists silk into thread).In 1889 the Mill was landscaped to provide a park for the local residents.The Mill pond was kept and is used to sail model boats.
